title: Extended Unbracketed Slab Serif
content:
I’m trying to remember the name of a typeface I saw not too long ago on the type ID board (I don’t remember anything else about the context except what the face looked like).

Clues:

• It is an unbracketed slab serif of medium weight  
• It is **quite** extended  
• The capital K splits like a Helvetica K  
• The capital J has a ball terminal  
• The capital R’s leg hooks up in the Clarendon fashion

Bonus clue:

• I also saw it recently on one of my grandmother’s circular Springbok puzzles. The puzzle dates back to 1965, so the face is predigital.
author: Ehague

comments.content:
Who needs a visual sample, anyway? Certainly not Jan, our _clairvoyant typographique!_  
;-)
